description.zh-cn: 台湾著名武侠小说家，原名熊耀华。籍贯江西南昌，出生于香港，后定居台湾。他创作了《楚留香传奇》、《绝代双骄》等多部脍炙人口的武侠小说，作品屡次被改编为影视剧。
description.en: A renowned Taiwanese wuxia novelist, originally named Xiong Yaohua. Born in Hong Kong and later settled in Taiwan, his ancestral home was Nanchang, Jiangxi. He authored many popular wuxia novels such as the 'Chu Liuxiang Series' and 'Juedai Shuangjiao', which have been frequently adapted into films and television series.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的父亲，曾以“东方客”为笔名发表武侠小说。后因婚外情抛弃家庭。
description.en: Gu Long's father, who also published wuxia novels under the pen name 'Dongfang Ke'. He later abandoned his family due to an extramarital affair.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的第一任妻子，与其同居并育有长子郑小龙。
description.en: Gu Long's first wife, with whom he cohabited and had his eldest son, Zheng Xiaolong.

description.zh-cn: 古龙正式登记结婚的妻子，育有一子熊正达，宝龙电影公司之名即取自二人名字。
description.en: Gu Long's officially registered wife, with whom he had a son, Xiong Zhengda. The 'Baolong Film Company' was named after them.

description.zh-cn: 古龙晚年的妻子，陪伴他直至逝世。
description.en: Gu Long's wife in his later years, who was with him until his death.

description.zh-cn: 古龙与郑月霞的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Gu Long and Zheng Yuexia.

description.zh-cn: 台湾演员。1980年在北投吟松阁因敬酒风波，其友人刺伤古龙，导致古龙健康状况急剧恶化。
description.en: A Taiwanese actor. In 1980, at the Yinsong Pavilion in Beitou, a dispute over a toast led to his associates stabbing Gu Long, causing a severe decline in Gu Long's health.

description.zh-cn: 柯俊雄的友人，在吟松阁事件中刺伤古龙的通缉犯。
description.en: An associate of Ko Chun-hsiung and a wanted criminal who stabbed Gu Long during the Yinsong Pavilion incident.

description.zh-cn: 香港作家，古龙的莫逆之交。他为《明报》邀请古龙撰写《绝代双骄》，并在古龙去世后，在其棺材里放入XO酒陪葬。
description.en: A Hong Kong writer and a very close friend of Gu Long. He invited Gu Long to write 'Juedai Shuangjiao' for Ming Pao daily and placed bottles of XO cognac in Gu Long's coffin for his burial.

description.zh-cn: 香港武侠小说家。在其封笔后，亲自为旗下的《明报》向古龙邀稿《陆小凤》系列。
description.en: A Hong Kong wuxia novelist. After he stopped writing novels, he personally invited Gu Long to write the 'Lu Xiaofeng Series' for his newspaper, Ming Pao.

description.zh-cn: 台湾知名黑社会组织，传闻古龙在离家出走后曾短暂加入。
description.en: A well-known triad in Taiwan, which Gu Long was rumored to have briefly joined after running away from home.

description.zh-cn: 由古龙于1980年创办的电影公司，名称取自其与妻子梅宝珠的名字。
description.en: A film company founded by Gu Long in 1980, named after himself and his wife, Mei Baozhu.

description.zh-cn: 台湾的一家主要报纸，曾连载古龙的小说《天涯‧明月‧刀》，但因理念前卫而中途停止刊载。
description.en: A major newspaper in Taiwan that serialized Gu Long's novel 'Tianya, Mingyue, Dao' but prematurely ended its publication due to its avant-garde concepts.

description.zh-cn: 香港电影公司。该公司于1976年将古龙的《流星‧蝴蝶‧剑》和《天涯‧明月‧刀》改编成电影，开创了武侠电影的高峰和古龙的电影时代。
description.en: A Hong Kong film studio. In 1976, its film adaptations of Gu Long's novels 'Meteor, Butterfly, Sword' and 'Tianya, Mingyue, Dao' initiated a peak in wuxia films and marked the beginning of the Gu Long movie era.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的武侠小说，因理念较为前卫，在《中国时报》连载时被腰斩。
description.en: A wuxia novel by Gu Long. Its serialization in the China Times was prematurely ended due to its avant-garde concepts.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的武侠小说，创作上向日本时代小说《宫本武藏》取经，探索武道。
description.en: A wuxia novel by Gu Long, which drew inspiration from the Japanese historical novel 'Miyamoto Musashi' to explore the way of martial arts.

description.zh-cn: 日本时代小说，对古龙创作《浣花洗剑录》产生了影响。
description.en: A Japanese historical novel that influenced Gu Long's creation of 'Huanhua Xijian Lu'.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的出生地。
description.en: Gu Long's birthplace.

description.zh-cn: 古龙逝世的地点。
description.en: The place where Gu Long passed away.

description.zh-cn: 古龙曾就读的大学，当时名为淡江英专。
description.en: The university Gu Long attended, known at the time as Tamkang English College.

description.zh-cn: 时任台湾行政院长，为古龙的墓碑题字“英才早凋”。
description.en: The then Premier of the Republic of China, who inscribed 'A brilliant talent passed away too soon' on Gu Long's tombstone.

description.zh-cn: 熊鹏声是古龙的父亲。
description.en: Xiong Pengsheng is Gu Long's father.

description.zh-cn: 熊鹏声因婚外情抛弃妻儿，导致古龙愤而离家出走并中断学业。
description.en: Xiong Pengsheng abandoned his wife and children for an extramarital affair, causing Gu Long to angrily run away from home and drop out of school.

description.zh-cn: 郑小龙是古龙与郑月霞的儿子。
description.en: Zheng Xiaolong is the son of Gu Long and Zheng Yuexia.

description.zh-cn: 古龙自1963年起与郑月霞同居，但未有正式婚姻登记。
description.en: Gu Long began cohabiting with Zheng Yuexia in 1963, but they were not formally married.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1976年与梅宝珠正式登记结婚，后离婚。
description.en: Gu Long officially registered his marriage with Mei Baozhu in 1976, and they later divorced.

description.zh-cn: 于秀铃是古龙晚年的妻子，陪伴他直至逝世。
description.en: Yu Xiuling was Gu Long's wife in his later years, staying with him until his death.

description.zh-cn: 1957年秋，古龙考入淡江英专（淡江大学前身）夜间部英语科，后因谋生而辍学。
description.en: In the autumn of 1957, Gu Long was admitted to the English Department of the Evening Division at Tamkang English College (the predecessor of Tamkang University), but later dropped out to make a living.

description.zh-cn: 传闻古龙在离家出走后，曾短暂加入学生帮派四海帮。
description.en: It is rumored that after running away from home, Gu Long briefly joined the student gang, the Four Seas Gang.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1980年创办了宝龙电影公司，以投入影剧事业。
description.en: Gu Long founded the Baolong Film Company in 1980 to engage in the film and television industry.

description.zh-cn: 自倪匡为《明报》向古龙邀稿《绝代双骄》后，二人结为莫逆之交。
description.en: After Ni Kuang invited Gu Long to write 'Juedai Shuangjiao' for Ming Pao, the two became very close friends.

description.zh-cn: 倪匡代表香港《明报》向古龙邀稿，促成了小说《绝代双骄》的诞生。
description.en: Representing Hong Kong's Ming Pao newspaper, Ni Kuang commissioned a manuscript from Gu Long, which led to the creation of the novel 'Juedai Shuangjiao'.

description.zh-cn: 金庸在自己封笔后，于1972年亲自为旗下的《明报》向古龙邀稿，促成了《陆小凤》系列的创作，此举有世代传承的意味。
description.en: After retiring from writing, Jin Yong personally invited Gu Long in 1972 to write for his newspaper Ming Pao, which led to the creation of the 'Lu Xiaofeng Series'. This act was seen as a passing of the torch between generations.

description.zh-cn: 香港邵氏公司于1976年将古龙的小说改编成电影，大获成功，开创了古龙的电影时代，使其作品声名鹊起。
description.en: In 1976, Hong Kong's Shaw Brothers Studio successfully adapted Gu Long's novels into films, initiating the Gu Long movie era and skyrocketing the popularity of his works.

description.zh-cn: 在1980年的吟松阁事件中，因古龙不愿向柯俊雄敬酒，柯的友人叶庆辉等人用刀刺伤古龙，导致其身受重伤。
description.en: During the 1980 Yinsong Pavilion incident, Gu Long was unwilling to offer a toast to Ko Chun-hsiung. As a result, Ko's associate Ye Qinghui and others stabbed and severely injured Gu Long.

description.zh-cn: 在1980年的吟松阁事件中，叶庆辉用扁钻及短刀刺伤古龙的右手，导致其后来无法写作，且因输血感染肝炎，健康急剧恶化。
description.en: During the 1980 Yinsong Pavilion incident, Ye Qinghui stabbed Gu Long's right hand with a blade, leaving him unable to write. Furthermore, a subsequent blood transfusion led to a hepatitis infection, causing his health to deteriorate rapidly.

description.zh-cn: 1974年，《中国时报》因认为小说《天涯‧明月‧刀》的理念过于前卫，在连载中途将其停止刊登（腰斩）。
description.en: In 1974, the China Times discontinued the serialization of the novel 'Tianya, Mingyue, Dao' midway, deeming its concepts too avant-garde.

description.zh-cn: 古龙在创作《浣花洗剑录》时，向日本时代小说《宫本武藏》取经，探索武道。
description.en: When writing 'Huanhua Xijian Lu', Gu Long drew inspiration from the Japanese historical novel 'Miyamoto Musashi' to explore the way of martial arts.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1938年6月7日出生于香港。
description.en: Gu Long was born in Hong Kong on June 7, 1938.

description.zh-cn: 古龙去世后，时任行政院长俞国华为其墓碑题字“英才早凋”，此举是对其文学成就的官方肯定和纪念。
description.en: After Gu Long's death, then-Premier Yu Kuo-hwa inscribed 'A brilliant talent passed away too soon' on his tombstone, an act of official recognition and commemoration of his literary achievements.
